titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:17-0400

did.unittitle: Recordings of Cherokee, Creek, Naskapi, Penobscot, Sioux, Santee, Tutelo, and Winnebago
did.abstract: Recordings of Cherokee, Naskapi, Penobscot, Sioux (Santee), and Winnebago materials. The copies in the APS Library were made from discs recorded by Speck in the field in various places in the United States, Canada, and Labrador between 1935 and 1937.
did.physdesc: 4 sound tape reels (1 hr., 45 min.) : analog, 7 1/2 ips, full track, mono ; 7 in.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Frank G. Speck papers in the APS Library contain many of Speck's original field notes and texts of this collection, but they are not cross-referenced to the recordings. Researchers should consult the APS American Indian guides under specific tribes and languages contained in this recording for possible further documentation.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Some of the original discs are in the Archives of Traditional Music at Indiana University in Bloomington, Indiana, while others are in the Museum of Primitive Art in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Performed by Jasper Blowsnake, Thunder Clan. Some sound distortion at beginning of program due to degradation of digital tape copy.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Phonograph record) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "No words for song but symbol is man puts on paint on face for good luck when he goes to make love, to play contest game, to visit in hope of getting a gift, to engage in war expedition." Performed by Jasper Blowsnake, Thunder Clan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Phonograph record) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The singer, Roland Nelson, was also known as Chief Needahbeh. Possibly identical to other Penobscot "Lullaby" from same collection. See Related Recording.

did.unittitle: Otter song in medicine lodge when candidate is shot with shell

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Singer and date of recording not given. Probably recorded between 1935-1937.

originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Phonograph record) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Girl's song. A girl, a daughter of the chief sings this song. She says 'I'm looking for a man (Chief's son) who wears a big stamped brooch on a cord around his neck.'" Performed by Jasper Blowsnake, Thunder Clan.
